de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture

Class DragGestureEventHandlerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.DragGestureEventHandlerFactory

  • public class DragGestureEventHandlerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory, which allows to create instances of the class AbstractDragGestureEventHandler.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DragGestureEventHandlerFactory(TabSwitcher tabSwitcher)
      Creates a new factory, which allows to create instances of the class AbstractDragGestureEventHandler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractTouchEventHandler fromGesture(DragGesture dragGesture)
      Creates and returns the event handler, which corresponds to a specific drag gesture.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DragGestureEventHandlerFactory

        public DragGestureEventHandlerFactory(@NonNull
                                      TabSwitcher tabSwitcher)
        Creates a new factory, which allows to create instances of the class AbstractDragGestureEventHandler.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, the event handler should be created for, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • fromGesture

        @NonNull
public final AbstractTouchEventHandler fromGesture(@NonNull
                                                            DragGesture dragGesture)
        Creates and returns the event handler, which corresponds to a specific drag gesture.
        Parameters:
        dragGesture - The drag gesture, the event handler should be created from, as an instance of the class DragGesture. The drag gesture may not be null
        Returns:
        The event handler, which has been created, as an instance of the class AbstractTouchEventHandler. The event handler may not be null
